channel.title: Standing on the shoulders of giants

item.title: Unresponsive process
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Choplin
item.description:
pkill -9f process-name

Example:

pkill -9f filezilla

item.title: Dummy smtp server in Python for testing
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Choplin
item.description:
sudo python -m smtpd -n -c DebuggingServer localhost:25

The sudo is needed as you canâ€™t bind to a port number lower than 1024 as a normal user.

Source: http://www.euperia.com/development/test-smtp-with-a-dummy-server-in-python/460

item.title: TDD with Django at Skills Matter
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Choplin
item.description:
Session animated by Harry Percival based on the book http://www.obeythetestinggoat.com/

For having the handout:

sudo pip3 install https://github.com/django/django/archive/stable/1.7.x.zip

Requirement:

  • Firefox
  • Git
  • Pip3
  • Selenium
  • Django 1.7 beta

item.title: Git
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Choplin
item.description:
Nice display of the current tree

git log --graph --all --format=format:"%x09%C(yellow)%h%C(reset) %C(green)%ai%x08%x08%x08%x08%x08%x08%C(reset) %C(bold white)%cn%C(reset)%C(magenta)%d%C(reset)%n%x09%C(white)%s%C(reset)" --abbrev-commit "$@"

Tutorial

Learn git from your browser: https://try.github.io/levels/1/challenges/1

item.title: The watch command
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Choplin
item.description: watch -n1 ' ps aux | grep what_you_want'

item.title: Extract list of installed packages
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Choplin
item.description:
dpkg-query -l | awk '{print $2 $3}'

Notice the combinatin of dpkg-query and awk!

item.title: Port forwarding
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Choplin
item.description:
Proxy configuration

ssh -D 8888 youruser@yourserver.com

For Firefox

Install foxyproxy addons.

For Chrome

Install Foxy Proxy standard: https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/foxyproxy-standard/gcknhkkoolaabfmlnjonogaaifnjlfnp

Then in Tools | Extensions | Options of FoxyProxy, change the settings.

Other links:
  • http://fr.flossmanuals.net/comment-contourner-la-censure-sur-internet/ch019_reglages-proxy-et-foxyproxy

item.title: Progress bar in python
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Choplin
item.description:
Writing 'r' will move the cursor back to the beginning of the line.

This displays a percentage counter:

import time,sys
for i in range(100):
    time.sleep(1)
    sys.stdout.write("\r%d%%" %i)
    sys.stdout.flush()

Sourcce: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3173320/text-progress-bar-in-the-console

item.title: VIM
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Choplin
item.description:
VIM basics

The built in tutorial of Vim is very useful to know the basics. To launch it simply type the following in your terminal:

$vimtutor

It will launch some lessons with an approach 'learning by doing'.

Configuration

The ~/.vimrc file provides Vim's default configuration

item.title: Symbolic links
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Choplin
item.description:
Dealing with broken symbolic links

Find broken symlinks and delete them

$find -L /path/to/check -type l -delete

List them

$find -L /path -type l

If you want to delete them with confirmation first, do

$find -L /path -type l -exec rm -i {} +

Creating symbolik links

First cd into your directory and then indicate where your symlinks will point

$find /directory_where_yout_symlinks_are/ -maxdepth 1 -type d -exec ln -s  {} \;

If you want to update your existing symlinks, use the -f option such as:

$find /home/matt/workspace/unified_repos/erp_core/modules/ -maxdepth 1 -type d -exec ln -sf  {} \;
